section.name: Introduction to XULUX
section.p: The main goals of XULUX is to provide an easy way to create frontends. The Frontend API that will result from the development of XULUX will provide an easy way to migrate current applications to XULUX and reuse the components that are already created or used by that application. The API allows easy integration of widgets and gui layers, rule engines and dataproviders. We aim to provide a default set of implementations to get a professional frontend up and running in no time and this way provide an easy look into the workings of XULUX. Please understand that this is a work in progress and by far doesn't yet offer the functionality specified above. Also much of the documentation that is provided is what is meant to be and not necessarily what is (yet). Please have a look at the features page to see in more detail what we are going to provide.

section.name: NYX and XULUX
section.p: The previous version of XULUX was called NYX, which is now obsoleted. You will still encounter the name NYX a lot of times in code and docs, but these will slowly migrate to be called XULUX or will be named differently in case of class names.

section.name: Releases
section.p:
Currently there are no releases of XULUX. Not even an alpha release. Since XULUX currrently still is a moving target, I think it is best to not have any releases, until the API stabelises. There are still some major things on the list to get done :
Finalize the dataprovider API and add some examples / dataproviders besides the current bean implementation.
Refactor of widgets. All widgets should be constructed out of eg PropertyHandlers, that handle all construction of widgets dynamically. Currently it is impossible to extend widgets without a lot of code duplication. Also changing the way the widget looks dynamically (eg background color, etc) is far from efficient.
Move out the rule engine functionality from the core and start using interfaces and make the rule engine flexible.
XULUX needs a lot of profiling to get it faster and more efficient. A lot of effort is currently in profiling, but currently not efficient enough.
Add more testing. The current test coverage is about 50%, which should be more than 80% as far as I am concerned.
Start removing the really old stuff in xulux that is holding back a big cleanup of code.
Write huge amounts of docs and write some nice examples. Currently it can be hard to start with xulux and although src/iutest gives some pointers on how to use xulux, it is hardly comparable with a real world example.
A nice Xulux IDE to make xulux application. Preferrably build in XULUX , but an Eclipse plugin would be nice too..
